alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 05 at 8:20PM CST until March 05 at 8:45PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM CST FOR CENTRAL LEE AND NORTHERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 820 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm was located over Donnellson, or 11 miles northwest of Nauvoo, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe storm will be near... Franklin around 825 PM CST. Nauvoo, West Point and Montrose around 830 PM CST. Other locations in the path of this severe thunderstorm include Fort Madison and Denmark. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for west central Illinois...southeastern Iowa...and northeastern Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building.
